net.proteusframework.ui.miwt

Class WindowManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.WindowManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PropertyChangeListener, EventListener, HttpSessionBindingListener, ComponentListener

    public class WindowManager
extends Object
implements PropertyChangeListener, HttpSessionBindingListener, ComponentListener
    The WindowManager manages the presentation, medium and event dispatch layers for one session of any number of MIWT applications.
    Author:
    Pat B. Double (double@i2rd.com)

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static String AJAX_ALT_DROPOPTIONS
      Parameter value for AJAX_ALT_PARAMETER that indicates we want drop options, see DropTarget.getDropOptions(Transferable).
      static String AJAX_ALT_PARAMETER
      The AJAX request parameter for alternate/library AJAX requests.
      protected Map<Long,Component> components
      Registry of components for fast lookup via component ID.
      protected Device device
      The Device object this WindowManager is using for display.
      protected long nextComponentId
      The next window id.
      protected long nextEventId
      The next event identifier.
      protected com.i2rd.miwt.component.DesktopContainer root
      The root window, must be a DesktopContainer.
      protected MIWTSession session
      The session this WindowManager is part of.

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public void add(Window win)
        Add a Window to the WindowManager. This allows the Window to be displayed in the medium. The Window becomes the active Window.
        Parameters:
        win - The Window to add, cannot be null
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the win parameter is null

      • addOriginalInvalidatedComponent

        public void addOriginalInvalidatedComponent(Component c)
        Add a component as having "original" invalidation.
        Parameters:
        c - the component.

                             Response response)

        Parameters:
        request - the request.
        response - the response.

      • alternateRender

                   Response response)
                           throws IOException
        Render updates for AJAX a library level AJAX request.
        Parameters:
        request - the request.
        response - the response.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
             throws CannotCloseMIWTException
        Destroy any resources allocated for this WindowManager. This includes destroying all windows and applications. The integration layer should call this when closing the session. Normally an application should not call this method because it will close other applications. To destroy one application, the MIWTApplication.destroy() method should be called. It is permitted for an application to do so if this functionality is desired from an application.
        Throws:
        CannotCloseMIWTException - if a component cannot be closed.

      • destroyAllWindows

        public void destroyAllWindows()
                       throws CannotCloseMIWTException
        Destroys all Window objects associated with this WindowManager.
        Throws:
        CannotCloseMIWTException - if a component cannot be closed.

      • getActiveWindow

        public Window getActiveWindow()
        Get the active Window object. This may return null if no Window object has been added to the WindowManager.
        Returns:
        Window, may be null.

      • getAjaxUri

        public String getAjaxUri()
        Get the URI for AJAX processing.
        Returns:
        String.

      • getCardContainerSelectors

        public Collection<CardContainerSelector> getCardContainerSelectors(CardContainer cc)
        Get the card container selectors for a card container.
        Parameters:
        cc - the card container.
        Returns:
        Collection of CardContainerSelector objects, may be empty.

      • getComponent

        public Component getComponent(long id)
        Get a component by ID. If a component has been removed from display, normally by removing from its enclosing Container, this method will return null for the ID. In this case the Component ID will have been set to -1, which is an invalid component ID in any case.
        Parameters:
        id - The component ID, which was assigned by the getNextComponentID() method.
        Returns:
        The Component with the given ID, or null if the ID is not assigned.

      • getComponentNDEs

        public List<NDE> getComponentNDEs()
        Get the required NDEs for individual components, this includes dependencies.
        Returns:
        list of NDE objects.

      • getDesktopContainer

        public com.i2rd.miwt.component.DesktopContainer getDesktopContainer()
        Get the desktop container.
        Returns:
        DesktopContainer.

      • getDevice

        public Device getDevice()
        Get the Device this WindowManager is using for display.
        Returns:
        The Device in use by this WindowManager

      • getDeviceMetric

        @Nullable
public DeviceMetric getDeviceMetric()
        Convenience method to get the DeviceMetric object used by the Device to realize Metric objects. This is a convience method for calling getDevice().getDeviceMetric(). If getDevice() returns null, then this method will return null and not throw a NullPointerException.
        Returns:
        The DeviceMetric object used to realize Metric objects

      • getDialogForApplication

        public Dialog getDialogForApplication(MIWTApplication app)
        This method gets the active Dialog for given the application. If there is no active Dialog this method returns null. The Dialog class is a modal implementation of Window, therefore only one active Dialog is allowed. The active Dialog is defined as the top-most visible Dialog.
        Parameters:
        app - The application.
        Returns:
        Dialog or null.

      • getFocusOrder

        public List<Component> getFocusOrder(Component top)
        Creates a list of components in focus order starting at the given component. This is most useful for medium subclasses of WindowManager although an application is permitted to use it.
        Parameters:
        top - The top of the component tree.
        Returns:
        List of Component objects in focus order.

      • getFormActionURI

        public String getFormActionURI()
        Get the form action URI.
        Returns:
        String.

      • getFormElementUniquePrefix

        public String getFormElementUniquePrefix(String prefix)
        Get an unique prefix for a form element.
        Parameters:
        prefix - the prefix.
        Returns:
        String.

      • getFormPrefix

        public String getFormPrefix()
        Get the form prefix.
        Returns:
        String.

      • getNextComponentId

        public long getNextComponentId()
        Get the next available component ID. Component IDs must unique for all components in a particular WindowManager. This method will increment the next available component ID. The Component class will handle allocating component IDs so this method normally will not need to be called except for specialized Component subclasses that need this functionality.
        Returns:
        long.

      • getNextEventId

        public long getNextEventId()
        Get the next unique event identifier. The next event ID is incremented so the following call to this method will return another event ID. The event layer handles allocating event IDs so the application developer rarely needs to call this method.
        Returns:
        long.

      • getNextTimerTime

        public long getNextTimerTime()
        Get the time that the next timer will fire. Call this method instead of MIWTSession.getNextTimer() as that method may queue events.
        Returns:
        long, less than zero if no timer is scheduled.

      • getPossibleLibraryNDEs

        public Collection<NDE> getPossibleLibraryNDEs(boolean singleComponent)
        Get all possible library NDEs.
        Parameters:
        singleComponent - true if only a single component is being rendered, false if the entire desktop.
        Returns:
        Collection of NDE.

      • getSession

        public MIWTSession getSession()
        Returns the session.
        Returns:
        MIWTSession

      • getWindowScrollCallback

        public WindowScrollCallback getWindowScrollCallback()
        Get the window scroll callback. Defaults to auto scrolling.
        Returns:
        the window scroll callback. Never null.

      • init

        public void init()
        Initialize any resources necessary for this WindowManager to run. This will only be called once per WindowManager object. The responsibility of calling this method lies with the integration of MIWT into some other system, such as from the main() method of a Java application.

      • isNextFocusedComponent

        public boolean isNextFocusedComponent(Component com)
        Returns true if the given component should receive focus in the next page.
        Parameters:
        com - the component.
        Returns:
        true if this component is the next to receive focus.

      • isReloadPage

        public boolean isReloadPage()
        Get the reload page flag.
        Returns:
        the reload page flag.

      • isRendering

        public boolean isRendering()
        Get the if we are rendering, used for sanity checks and debugging.
        Returns:
        true if rendering.

      • propertyChange

        public void propertyChange(PropertyChangeEvent event)
        Specified by:
        propertyChange in interface PropertyChangeListener

      • registerComponent

        public void registerComponent(Component com)
        This method is used by the Component class to register itself with the WindowManager. An application should never need to call this method.
        Parameters:
        com - The component to register.

      • registerDragSource

        public void registerDragSource(DragSource dragSource)
        Register the drag source such that at the next opportunity the WindowManager will perform the drop operation. This method is normally called from Component.preRenderProcess(Request, Response, RendererEditorState) .
        Parameters:
        dragSource - the drag source.

      • registerDropTarget

        public void registerDropTarget(DropTarget dropTarget)
        Register the drop target such that at the next opportunity the WindowManager will perform the drop operation. This method is normally called from Component.preRenderProcess(Request, Response, RendererEditorState) .
        Parameters:
        dropTarget - the drop target.

      • remove

        public void remove(Window win)
        Remove the given Window from the WindowManager.
        Parameters:
        win - The Window to remove, must not be null

      • requestFocus

        public void requestFocus(Component com)
        Requests that the given component get the focus. This method does nothing. A medium subclass must implement. This method is not normally called, use Component.requestFocus() instead.
        Parameters:
        com - The component to receive focus.

      • setAjaxUri

        public void setAjaxUri(String s)
        Set the URI for AJAX processing.
        Parameters:
        s - the path to set.

      • setDevice

        protected void setDevice(Device device)
        Set the Device this WindowManager will use for display.
        Parameters:
        device - The Device to use

      • setFormActionURI

        public void setFormActionURI(String uri)
        Set the form action URI. This is valid for the life of the current request only. If null then the form action becomes the URI that was used to request the page.
        Parameters:
        uri - the uri to set as the form action.

      • setReloadPage

        public void setReloadPage()
        Indicates the page should be reloaded.

      • setWindowScrollCallback

        public void setWindowScrollCallback(WindowScrollCallback windowScrollCallback)
        Set the window scroll callback.
        Parameters:
        windowScrollCallback - the window scroll callback.

      • unregisterComponent

        public void unregisterComponent(Component com)
        Remove a component from this WindowManager. Applications should NEVER call this directly. Components should already be removed from their enclosing container.
        Parameters:
        com - The component to unregister.

      • valueBound

        public void valueBound(HttpSessionBindingEvent event)
        Implementation of HttpSessionBindingListener. Upon being unbound the WindowManager will be destroyed.
        Specified by:
        valueBound in interface HttpSessionBindingListener

      • valueUnbound

        public void valueUnbound(HttpSessionBindingEvent event)
        Implementation of HttpSessionBindingListener. Upon being unbound the WindowManager will be destroyed.
        Specified by:
        valueUnbound in interface HttpSessionBindingListener
